snippet: Provisions of the Trans-Pacific Partnership agreement would protect wildlife covered by an existing international agreement, and provide for cross-border cooperation on enforcement.

byline.original: By RON NIXON and CORAL DAVENPORT

abstract: Environmentalists laud wildlife protections in new Trans-Pacific Partnership trade deal; provisions cover trade in animal parts and fishing subsidies.

keywords.value: Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Provisions of the Trans-Pacific Partnership agreement would protect wildlife covered by an existing international agreement, and provide for cross-border cooperation on enforcement.

headline.print_headline: Strong Praise From Environmentalists on Measures in Trans-Pacific Trade Pact
headline.main: Environmentalists Praise Wildlife Measures in Trans-Pacific Trade Pact
